intro: Tambourissa obovata, commonly known as the broad-ovate tambourissa, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate to broadly ovate leaves that are often hairy. It produces small, clustered flowers with four petals, typically in shades of white or pink. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release its seeds, facilitating wind dispersal.
